DataElement.preferredName: Baseline Malignant Neoplasm Longest Diameter Sum Millimeter Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to the longest baseline diameter of a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues, in millimeters, a metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the longest baseline diameter of a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Baseline; an imaginary standard by which things are measured or compared.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A starting point to which things may be compared.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.:Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information relating to the sum measurement of a lesions dimension in millimeters, a metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The final aggregate amount.:A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.:Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
